headline: Dollar Tree (DLTR): Is the Stock Overvalued After Its Powerful 12-Month Rally?
summary: Dollar Tree (DLTR) has quietly turned into one of the market’s stronger retail stories, with the stock up about 67% this year and roughly 75% over the past 12 months. See our latest analysis for Dollar Tree. That kind of move is hard to ignore, with a roughly 25.6% 1 month share price return and a 75.3% 1 year total shareholder return. This suggests momentum is firmly building as investors reassess Dollar Tree’s earnings power and risk profile. If Dollar Tree’s run has you rethinking where...
